sentences.english: His reputation may even have been enhanced among opponents of Washington's heavy-handed foreign policy.
sentences.chinese: 卡扎菲甚至在反對華盛頓鐵腕政策中的人中名聲鵲起。

sentences.english: The conqueror governed his new subjects with an iron scepter .
sentences.chinese: 征服者以鐵腕統治其新臣民。

sentences.english: At home, Gaddafi rules with an iron hand.
sentences.chinese: 在國內，卡扎菲用鐵腕統治。

sentences.english: He has a very, very strong image across Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他是全歐洲非常非常鐵腕的人物。

sentences.english: The Moon is a Harsh Mistress. Robert Heinlein.
sentences.chinese: 月亮是一個被鐵腕政權統治的嚴酷的殖民地。

sentences.english: Boss, suicide continues to happen in the company after the application of your iron-hand policy.
sentences.chinese: 老闆，自從你推行鐵腕政策後就不斷有員工自殺。

sentences.english: Bismarck ruled Germany by a strong hand.
sentences.chinese: 俾斯麥用鐵腕手段統治德國。

sentences.english: The Moon is a Harsh Mistress. Robert Heinlein. The moon is a penal colony ruled by an iron-fisted administration.
sentences.chinese: 月亮是成爲一個被鐵腕政權統治的嚴酷的殖民地。

sentences.english: The paper is openly critical of the strong-arm president.
sentences.chinese: 該報紙對這位鐵腕總統進行公開的批評。

sentences.english: The strong men must have their stooges .
sentences.chinese: 鐵腕人物手下一定有唯命是從的人。

sentences.english: Under Moggi's and the tirad's reign, Juve won, won and just won.
sentences.chinese: 在莫吉的統治和鐵腕管理下，尤文一直在勝利。

definition: to crack down on/to take severe measures against
to make secret inquiries/to investigate in secret
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
to crack down on illegal activities/to fight organized crime
to uphold virtue and condemn evil (idiom)
